posts.post_content: I honestly don't know why this guy is getting so much crap from everyone. He's cheap, a decent 2/2, buffs all your other vampires, and is great for breaking those akward mid-game draws that last forever. Just steal whatever's bothering you. And best of all, this guy is't $18 a pop!!! XD

posts.post_content: nocturnus was a over powered card and costs some where around $20 - $30 to get if you were not lucky enough to find one in a pack. At least with this guy he is allot cheaper price wise, unconditionally buffs vampires, and has an ability to steal creatures AND make them vampires?!?!? [Mind Control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Control) takes 5 mana to do that and if its destroyed you lose control of the creature, and it doesn't turn them into vampires. For black, creatures usually have to be dead in order to take control of them. I personally love to take my opponents cards while playing and smack them in the face with there own spell or card. Its allot more fun then going "Derp... OP aresomennersssss! I pewned Yerp Sorrys Buttt with mies net deck. Cuzz I so guud I can copys other peps decks..." Personally I wish they made a lord like this for the merfolk. I loved the **tap 5 untapped (*creature type*) you control do something awesome** ability back in onslaught. I only wish it didn't only belong ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: lorendorky (7/10/2010 9:45:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'm pretty sure everyone griping about the art here is taking it the wrong way... I don't think Wizards is pandering to the Twilight crowd, I think they're taking a shot at them. Yeah, he's a gay emo looking vampire, but so is Edward Cullen, and for some reason, millions of girls are captivated by him too. The art, the name, and the ability are satirical. And in all honesty, that's a pretty cool ability. Maybe not useful for the 5 turn death race of standard, but as a casual player, I love nifty things like this.
posts.html:

Yeah, he's a gay emo looking vampire, but so is Edward Cullen, and for some reason, millions of girls are captivated by him too. The art, the name, and the ability are satirical. Posted By: BilliamQ (7/14/2010 7:40:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I run 4. If you have 5 vampires out (should be fairly easy) and your opponent has no removal for ONE TURN, it's usually game. If you have two or three captivators out, not only are you stealing their creature, you're pumping them up significantly. Also, you can use his ability the turn he comes out as long as you have 5 other vamps.  
  
I used to hate the art as well, but when I started beating people with this guy, he captivated even me.
posts.html:

Posted By: benegade (8/2/2010 1:20:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I love this card... I honestly don't think I could care less about peoples opinions regarding art quality and tournament playability. For a casual vampire deck... and as an easy turn 3 drop, I'd be very happy with the outcome. I get to boost my existing and future vampires, and on the off chance I get 5 on the board, then the game just got a whole lot more interesting.
  
   
Just take it as it is; a fun, characterful card.

posts.post_content:
I wonder how this card would have rated if it didn't have [Vampire Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nocturnus) to live up to. I like this card; no, it's no Nocturnus, but sometimes players like rare cards that are under $5 instead of $15+ Mythics. He'll have a place in many more budget-friendly Vampire decks. And again, I wonder what people would say about him other than "Not a good repalcement for Nocturnus."  
  
@Diacrhonos: I will explain better. I *love* this card. 5/5. I only wonder how he would compare without Nocturnus around because the first half a dozen comments I read about this card said he sucked because of Nocturnus and ranted at Wizards for not reprinting the aforementioned Mythic Rare. I love him regardless of Nocturnus; I'd never play an expensive mythic rare anyway. Over $10 is beyond my desire to pay for a single card.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@sarroth:  
Yes, because comparing a Rare to a Mythic makes so much sense.  
  
I can see Captivating Vampire becoming a key component to many Vampire decks. You can steal creatures, and at the same time you're getting more Vampires to: let you steal MORE creatures, fuel spells like Blood Tribute, enhance the effects of Malakir Bloodwitch, More creatures to benefit from Vampire Nocturnus...   
  
Heck, I'd be surprised to find a Vampire player who doesn't want *four* of these guys.
